newsitem.title: ECUADOR: Ecuadoran students protest price rises.
newsitem.headline: Ecuadoran students protest price rises.

text.p: Ecuadoran student protests against big rises in the cost of public services ended in violence on Tuesday, as police fired tear gas at demonstrators around Quito's Central University.
"Two people were wounded. Someone fired and a young man was wounded in the arm, while another was hit in the eye by a tear gas canister," a Reuters photographer on the scene said.
The students were protesting against increases in electricity, telephone, gas and transport charges announced by President Abdala Bucaram as part of an austerity plan.
Ecuadoran unions said on Monday they were considering a general strike on Feb. 5 against Bucaram's tough economic reforms, which include scrapping subsidies to public services.
Domestic gas prices have shot up by 250 percent and electricity by more than 100 percent. Bus fares have doubled and telephone rates have also increased substantially.
Opposition parties are considering forming a united front against the tariff rises and a planned currency convertibility programme that would peg the sucre to the U.S. dollar.
